claims.text: the main driver of SK's AI business and, furthermore, the core that leads the AI business for the entire SK Group
claims.speaker: SK Telecom
claims.context: Official statement at the launch of the AI CIC (Company-in-Company) in September 2025, defining the new unit's role within the broader SK Group conglomerate. The AI CIC consolidates all AI functions under CEO Ryu Young-sang with KRW 5 trillion ($3.6B) committed over 5 years.
claims.rhetoricalFunction: Organizational identity claim that positions the AI CIC not merely as an internal business unit but as the conglomerate-wide AI leadership entity. The phrase 'core that leads' stakes a claim to centrality — this is not a supporting function or an experiment, but the nucleus of AI for the entire SK Group. The escalation from 'main driver of SK's AI business' to 'the core that leads the AI business for the entire SK Group' performs a scope expansion: what starts as an SKT initiative is framed as group-level leadership.
claims.notes: Attributed to SK Telecom as a company statement. The TelecomTV article reports this as SKT's own characterization. Confidence in verbatim accuracy: medium-high. Secondary type: transformation-framing (scope expansion from SKT to SK Group signals organizational metamorphosis).

claims.text: We will leap into SKT's version of a distinguished AI company that combines AI with connective technologies based on our main business of telecommunications.
claims.speaker: Ryu Young-sang
claims.context: Town hall meeting with employees marking the one-year anniversary of Ryu's inauguration (approximately late 2023 or early 2024). Ryu framing SKT's transformation from telecom to AI company while retaining telecommunications as the foundation.
claims.rhetoricalFunction: Transformation-framing that navigates the tension between legacy and future. 'SKT's version of a distinguished AI company' asserts uniqueness — not just any AI company, but one built on telecom DNA. 'Based on our main business of telecommunications' anchors the transformation in existing competency rather than abandoning it. This is organizational identity preservation through transformation: we become AI, but we don't stop being telecom. The word 'leap' signals discontinuous change, not gradual evolution.
claims.source: Korea Herald — SK Telecom CEO vows all-out transformation
claims.notes: The tension between 'distinguished AI company' and 'based on our main business of telecommunications' is structurally similar to how Microsoft navigated 'cloud + AI' without abandoning Windows. Ryu is trying to thread the needle of radical transformation without identity abandonment.

claims.speaker: Ryu Young-sang
claims.context: September 25, 2025 company-wide town hall meeting announcing the AI CIC launch. Ryu framing the current moment as an unprecedented opportunity that justifies the $3.6B AI investment and organizational restructuring.
claims.rhetoricalFunction: Utopian framing that uses the 'golden era' metaphor to convert uncertainty into opportunity. The phrase implies that this is a historically unique window — golden eras are temporary, which creates urgency. If you don't act now, the golden era passes. This is purpose as temporal framing: the AI CIC isn't just a strategic choice, it's a response to a once-in-a-generation moment. The utopian element is that AI is framed as fundamentally generative rather than disruptive.
claims.source: Korea Tech Today — SK Telecom Commits $3.6B to AI
claims.notes: Short fragment. The 'golden era' framing is characteristically different from Western CEO rhetoric — Benioff says 'revolution,' Zuckerberg says 'new era,' Ryu says 'golden era.' Each temporal metaphor carries different connotations: revolution implies disruption, new era implies beginning, golden era implies peak opportunity.

claims.text: customer trust has been and will be our most valuable asset
claims.speaker: Ryu Young-sang
claims.context: CEO Message for the 'Renaissance of SK Telecom' (2025). Published after a massive data breach compromised 23 million customer records, with SKT committing $514M to security upgrades. Ryu linking AI transformation to customer trust restoration.
claims.rhetoricalFunction: Identity claim that defines SKT through customer trust rather than technology or market position. This is notable because it was delivered in the context of a data breach crisis — the identity claim is doing repair work, not transformation work. The phrase 'has been and will be' asserts temporal continuity: trust was always central and will remain so, even through the AI transformation. This anchors the AI CIC in an existing value (trust) rather than a new one (AI leadership).
claims.source: SK Telecom Newsroom — CEO Message: For the Renaissance of SK Telecom
claims.notes: The juxtaposition of a trust-centered identity claim with the data breach context creates an interesting dynamic. Unlike other specimens where identity claims authorize transformation, here the identity claim constrains transformation — AI innovation must not compromise customer trust. This is purpose as guardrail rather than purpose as accelerant.

claims.text: We cannot create real change by simply working harder while relying on old ways of thinking.
claims.speaker: Jung Jai-hun
claims.speakerTitle: CEO, SK Telecom (successor to Ryu Young-sang)
claims.context: First town hall meeting as new CEO of SK Telecom (approximately late 2025/early 2026). Jung outlining a shift from scale-driven growth to efficiency and AI, replacing EBITDA with ROIC as the key performance metric.
claims.rhetoricalFunction: Direction-under-uncertainty from a new CEO establishing legitimacy by naming what the old approach got wrong. 'Old ways of thinking' is an implicit critique of the predecessor's approach — or at least of organizational inertia. The claim sets direction by elimination (not harder, not old ways) rather than prescription (here's the new way). The humility is notable: Jung described himself as a 'Chief Change Officer' and promised 'management will take responsibility for failures.' This is direction-setting through institutional humility.
claims.source: Korea Herald — New SKT CEO pivots focus to efficiency, AI
claims.notes: Interesting succession dynamic: Ryu launched the AI CIC with utopian 'golden era' framing; his successor Jung pivots to efficiency and humility. Two CEOs, two registers, one transformation. Compare with the Zuckerberg/Wang rhetorical division at Meta — but here the division is temporal (predecessor vs. successor) rather than simultaneous (CEO vs. CAIO).
